reviews.title: It's a good place to learn and gain experience

reviews.cons: The base salary is lower compared to other companies in the same business.

reviews.title: Fantastic Company
reviews.pros: Amzing work life balance. Good pay and a truly amazing manager!
reviews.advice: Keep doing what your doing Jason

reviews.title: Not Recommended At This Instance
reviews.pros: Good benefit, flexible hours, standard pay for middle management level.
reviews.cons: Surprisingly a very traditional and conservative manager for a tech company. The company needs fresh leaders with more energy who understands technology and travel. Direction is very unclear. Upper management is too busy competing with one another for top management’s attention and self promotion. As much as they claim to uphold diversity, the upper management is very much not diverse.
reviews.advice: Listen to your employees more, especially the non-upper management — team who is on the ground, carrying out executional task. Set your direction loud and clear. It is really sad seeing the brand getting sluggish, slow, and obsolete. The name deteriorates and the platform is catered for boomers due to lack of fresh and modern ideas.

reviews.title: Mean girls club
reviews.pros: Great benefits! Awesome people that love’s adventure!
reviews.cons: Some teams are purely ran by mean women! It sucks the joy out of employees. HR is a joke when it comes to ensuring employees are held accountable for there poor performance. But, managers are somehow supposed to keep those same people accountable.
reviews.advice: Get rid of your clicks. You’ll continue losing people if you don’t.

reviews.title: If you want to live paycheck to paycheck you should work here!
reviews.pros: - The people for the most part are great - Executive leadership has recently changed for the better
reviews.cons: - Refuse to do market adjustments for their employees, therefore a number of people are living paycheck to paycheck - No clear path for growth within the company, they prefer to hire from outside - The internal systems are always broken - Operates like a startup putting out one fire after the other despite having 5,000 employees - Severely understaffed - Leadership tends to gaslight (career path, solving issues, career trajectory) - Leadership lacks autonomy despite the silo'd structure - Last but not least, severely underpaid
reviews.advice: I won't bother since it wouldn't be taken into consideration anyways. These concerns have been brought to light by multiple people yet nothing has changed. I'm sure this review will get a response from HR saying that they continually do market analysis in respect to salary, but that would also be a classic example of Tripadvisor gaslighting current and potential employees.
